Key Match Events: Zach Dezenzo drew a go-ahead bases-loaded walk in the eighth inning.
Houston Astros took advantage of two Kansas City errors in a four-run eighth inning to beat the Royals 6-3.
Ryan Pressly pitched a scoreless eighth to earn the win after being activated from the 15-day injured list.
Josh Hader pitched a perfect ninth to earn his 29th save of the season.
Hunter Brown allowed two hits and no earned runs while striking out four and walking one in 6 2/3 innings on his 26th birthday.
Jason Heyward made a splash in his Astros debut with a two-run double down the right-field line.
Post-Match Reflections: Astros manager Joe Espada commented, 'These guys like big moments like that. That’s a huge win for us, right there.'

Hunter Brown reflected on his performance, saying, 'I could not wait to pitch against these guys. I got bounced in the first inning, and that was definitely still on my mind even though it was however many months ago. So, once I got through the first inning, that was awesome. I was very thankful. That was a birthday gift, in itself.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Astros third baseman Alex Bregman was ejected in the fourth inning after appearing to complain about a strike-three call from home plate umpire Alex Tosi.
Royals shortstop Bobby Witt Jr., who leads the American League in hits, batting average and runs, went 0 for 4 after hitting safely in 16 of his previous 17 games.
Others: Royals RHP Seth Lugo (14-8, 3.19 ERA) will start against Astros LHP Framber Valdez (13-6, 3.27) on Friday.
Royals: RF Hunter Renfroe (right hamstring strain) is 'feeling better' and started running and doing a full workout on Wednesday, manager Matt Quatraro said.
Astros: RF Kyle Tucker (shin contusion) has 'looked really good' in drills and sprinting exercises, and 'we’re getting there,' Espada said before the game.
